snippet: Mr. Higham, whose books drew vast attention for their memorably vast claims, wrote a number of biographies on some of Hollywood’s biggest stars.
abstract: Charles Higham, prolific celebrity biographer, dies at age 81. Photo (M)/
lead_paragraph: Charles Higham, a prolific celebrity biographer whose books drew vast attention for their memorably vast claims (Errol Flynn was a Nazi spy, Howard Hughes played a central role in Watergate), died on April 21 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 81. His death, apparently of a heart attack, was announced on Wednesday by his friend Todd McCarthy, the chief film critic of The Hollywood Reporter.

headline.main: Charles Higham, Celebrity Biographer, Is Dead at 81
